title: Red Pepper and Tomato Sauce
introduction: Bagnetto Rosso, or Red Pepper and Tomato Sauce, is a vibrant and versatile condiment from Piedmont in northern Italy. Traditionally, it is crafted in substantial quantities during the bountiful summer months. This hearty, zesty sauce complements a variety of dishes, from boiled meats and chicken to pasta, omelets, and raw vegetables.
ingredients: 1 cup peeled, seeded, and chopped fresh tomatoes
instructions: In a large pot, combine all of the ingredients. Cover the pot and cook over low heat. Bring to a simmer, ensuring the mixture does not scorch. Add a little water if necessary. Cook for 1 hour, stirring occasionally, until the peppers are very tender.

Let cool slightly. Pass the ingredients through a food mill or process until smooth in a blender or food processor. Taste for seasoning. Transfer the sauce to tightly sealed containers and refrigerate up to 1 week or freeze up to three months. Serve at room temperature.
